title: Marky Cielo
text:
Mark Angelo Cadaweng Cielo (May 12, 1988 – December 7, 2008), better known as Marky Cielo, was a <a href="Filipino%20people">Filipino</a> <a href="actor">actor</a>, <a href="dancer">dancer</a>, and the first known <a href="Igorot%20people">Igorot</a> in Philippine showbiz. He was notable for his win in the <a href="reality%20television">reality</a> <a href="talent%20show">talent competition</a> "<a href="StarStruck%20%28Philippine%20TV%20series%29">StarStruck</a>" (March 12, 2006). During his two-year career, he was able to star in several television shows and in one film, notably "<a href="Fantastikids">Fantastikids</a>" (2006), "<a href="Asian%20Treasures">Asian Treasures</a>" (2007), "<a href="Boys%20Nxt%20Door">Boys Nxt Door</a>" (2007), "" (2007–2008), "<a href="Sine%20Novela">Sine Novela</a>: <a href="Kaputol%20ng%20Isang%20Awit">Kaputol ng Isang Awit</a>" (2008), and his final performance, "<a href="LaLola%20%28Philippine%20TV%20series%29">LaLola</a>" (2008). He also dubbed into Filipino language to be voiced of the character <a href="Ichigo%20Kurosaki">Ichigo Kurosaki</a> in the <a href="anime">anime</a> "<a href="Bleach%20%28TV%20series%29">Bleach</a>" (2007).
Early life.
Mark Angelo Cadaweng Cielo, better known as Boknoi to his family and friends, was born on May 12, 1988 at Manuel J. Santos Hospital in <a href="Butuan%20City">Butuan</a> in <a href="Agusan%20del%20Norte">Agusan del Norte</a>, where he lived with his mother, Mildred Ban-eg Cadaweng and sister, Marcel Andrea or "Bonsai". In 2001, he and his family moved to <a href="Bauko%2C%20Mountain%20Province">Bauko</a>, <a href="Mountain%20Province">Mountain Province</a> to live with their other relatives, who are of <a href="Igorot">Igorot</a> descent. As a student of the local high school, San Isidro, he would soon become proud of his <a href="Indigenous%20peoples%20of%20the%20Philippines">indigenous roots</a>, despite being raised in the <a href="Roman%20Catholicism%20in%20the%20Philippines">Roman Catholic environment</a>. He fluently spoke <a href="Kankana-ey%20language">Kankana-ey</a>, a language spoken in the <a href="Cordillera%20Administrative%20Region">Cordilleras</a>. Aside from this, he was also fluent in English, <a href="Ilocano%20language">Ilocano</a>, <a href="Tagalog%20language">Tagalog</a>, and <a href="Visayan%20languages">Visayan languages</a> (specifically <a href="Butuanon%20language">Butuanon</a> and <a href="Cebuano%20language">Cebuano</a>). According to an episode of "<a href="Magpakailanman">Magpakailanman</a>" which revolved around life, his parents separated when he was still young and his mother took care of him, along with his sister on her own. Despite this, he was able to reunite with his father, Avelino "Bobby" Cielo, and spend time with him after many years. Later in his life, he had stated, privately, that he truly loves his father.
Career.
Prior to his career, Cielo was a freshman studying <a href="Architecture">Architecture</a> at <a href="Saint%20Louis%20University%2C%20Baguio%20City">Saint Louis University</a>, <a href="Baguio%20City">Baguio</a> in <a href="Benguet">Benguet</a>, where he was a member of <a href="SLU%20Dance%20Troupe">SLU Dance Troupe</a>. When his classmates and close friends convinced him to audition for Starstruck, he accepted so he joined under the stage name, Marky Cielo. He audition for "<a href="StarStruck%20%28Philippine%20TV%20series%29">Starstruck</a>" where he emerged as "Ultimate Male Survivor" and the first and only "Sole Survivor", defeating his fellow contestants <a href="Jackie%20Rice">Jackie Rice</a>, Gian Carlos, <a href="Iwa%20Moto">Iwa Moto</a>, Chuck Allie, and <a href="Arci%20Mu%C3%B1oz">Arci Muñoz</a>. He is the first <a href="Igorot">Igorot</a> ever to join a talent contest. He won 10 million <a href="Philippine%20Peso">pesos</a> worth of prizes and an exclusive <a href="GMA%20Network">GMA</a> talent management contract, and a house and lot in <a href="Antipolo%20City">Antipolo</a>, <a href="Rizal%20%28province%29">Rizal</a>. He and his family moved to this new home only in 2008, during his birthday, May 12. Prior to that, he lived in <a href="Pasig">Pasig</a>.
Soon after winning StarStruck, Cielo made his debut as the lead role Daniel Trinidad in the <a href="fantasy">fantasy</a> television show, "<a href="Fantastikids">Fantastikids</a>". After this, he began to appear in primetime with guest starring roles in shows first in ' as <a href="Arman">Arman</a>, then "<a href="Bakekang">Bakekang</a>" as Miguelito "Michael" Dimayacyac and "<a href="Asian%20Treasures">Asian Treasures</a>" as Mateo Madrigal;, as well as a leading role in the Sunday afternoon drama, "<a href="Boys%20Nxt%20Door">Boys Nxt Door</a>", which is dubbed in <a href="Malay%20language">Malay</a> by <a href="8TV%20%28Malaysia%29">8TV</a> and is to be the first <a href="Philippine%20drama">Philippine drama</a> to air on <a href="KBS2">KBS2</a> of <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a>. In 2007, he and fellow "StarStruck" graduates, <a href="Yasmien%20Kurdi">Yasmien Kurdi</a> and <a href="Rainier%20Castillo">Rainier Castillo</a> decided to shift from mainstream acting to voice acting for a while by trying <a href="List%20of%20Bleach%20characters">characters</a> from the <a href="anime">anime</a> "<a href="Bleach%20%28TV%20series%29">Bleach</a>", such as <a href="Ichigo%20Kurosaki">Ichigo Kurosaki</a>. During the same year, he won the Guillermo Mendoza Memorial Scholarship Foundation Award for Most Promising Male Artist. He was soon chosen by his <a href="GMA%20Network">network</a> to be the main protagonist in the <a href="Philippines">Philippine</a> remake of "<a href="Uchuu%20Keiji%20Shaider">Uchuu Keiji Shaider</a>" as Alexis del Mundo or Shaider but <a href="Dennis%20Trillo">Dennis Trillo</a> and <a href="Aljur%20Abrenica">Aljur Abrenica</a> were included so the show was reformatted to "," a spin-off sequel to the <a href="Metal%20Hero%20Series">Metal Hero Series</a>. He joined the cast of "<a href="Sine%20Novela">Sine Novela</a>: <a href="Kaputol%20ng%20Isang%20Awit">Kaputol ng Isang Awit</a>", which also stars <a href="Glaiza%20de%20Castro">Glaiza de Castro</a>, <a href="Lovi%20Poe">Lovi Poe</a> and <a href="Bong%20Revilla%23Personal%20life">Jolo Revilla</a>. He was also a spokesman for <a href="Department%20of%20Health%20%28Philippines%29">Department of Health</a> and was seen in a no-smoking ad campaign with secretary <a href="Francisco%20Duque">Francisco Duque III</a>. In 2008, he joined the cast of ' then "<a href="LaLola%20%28Philippine%20TV%20series%29">LaLola</a>". His last appearance was in "<a href="LaLola%20%28Philippine%20TV%20series%29">LaLola</a>", in which he portrayed the character Billy Lobregat.
Death.
Cielo, 20, was found unconscious on December 7, 2008 by his mother. The night before, he was last seen playing an <a href="MMORPG">online video game</a> up until 10 PM in an <a href="internet%20cafe">internet cafe</a> in <a href="Quezon%20City">Quezon City</a>. Marky is said to have made several unanswered calls to his manager-mentor. When he arrived home, he had a discussion with his mother about "something personal". His mother advised Marky to sort out his problem saying that only he can solve his problems. The next morning, his mother entered his room in their house in <a href="Antipolo%20City">Antipolo</a> at around 6 AM to wake him up for a charity event. When he did not respond, she immediately rushed him to the nearby Antipolo Doctors Hospital where he was declared dead on arrival. At present, the cause of Cielo’s death remains unknown. This led to speculations of <a href="suicide">suicide</a> precipitated by threats which allegedly came from the son of Governor <a href="Luis%20%26quot%3BChavit%26quot%3B%20Singson">Luis "Chavit" Singson</a>, <a href="Ronald%20Singson">Ronald</a> due to him being too close to <a href="Lovi%20Poe">Lovi Poe</a>. These facts were never discussed or even became and angle for the police to dig more into the case because of their fear of getting caught up with the influence of Governor Singson.
His <a href="Wake%20%28ceremony%29">wake</a> was held in his home for three days then his remains were brought to the Cathedral of the Resurrection in <a href="Baguio">Baguio</a>, where it stayed for a day. He was buried on December 15, in <a href="Bauko%2C%20Mountain%20Province">Bauko, Mountain Province</a>, in his family's backyard according to traditional <a href="Kankanaey%20people">Kankanaey</a> custom.
